p: Coupled particle-hydrodynamic models are used to assess risks of transmission of pathogens between sites in aquaculture. Locally they have been used to assess transmission of the sea louse (L epeophtheirus salmonis) between salmon farms in Loch Linnhe ( Salama et al., 2013) and Loch Fyne ( Adams et al., 2012) and from these derive contact networks. In the absence of such a contact structure for the whole Scottish salmon farming regions a method of developing such a contact network was derived by the method described below.
